title: Port Authority to vote on New York, New Jersey rail projects
text:
NEW YORK (AP) - The Port Authority of New York and New Jersey is set to vote on several rail projects with a total cost of billions of dollars.

The bi-state authority’s board will vote at Thursday’s meeting on a new rail link between Manhattan and LaGuardia Airport and a replacement for Newark Liberty International Airport’s monorail.

Each is expected to cost about $2 billion.

The LaGuardia rail link would use the Long Island Rail Road’s Willets Point station, which also serves Citi Field and the U.S. National Tennis Center.

Board members also are scheduled to vote on authorizing about $80 million to lengthen platforms on the PATH rail line between New Jersey and New York to accommodate longer trains.
